Question Text: What is the probability of rolling a 3 on a fair six-sided die?
If X is a random variable representing the sum of two six-sided dice. what is P(X=7)?
The mean of a random variable X is 50 and the standard deviation is 10. What is P(X>60)?
The lifetime of a battery is normally distributed with a mean of 500 hours and a standard deviation of 50 hours. Find P(X<450).
For a binomial random variable with n=10 and p=0.5. what is the mean?
For a binomial random variable with n=10 and p=0.5. what is the variance?
The height of students in a school is normally distributed with a mean of 160 cm and a standard deviation of 10 cm. What is the probability that a student is taller than 170 cm?
The weight of apples in a basket is normally distributed with a mean of 100 grams and a standard deviation of 15 grams. What is the probability that an apple weighs between 85 and 115 grams?
A factory produces bulbs with a lifetime that is exponentially distributed with a mean of 1000 hours. What is the probability that a bulb lasts more than 1200 hours?
The number of cars passing through a toll booth follows a Poisson distribution with a mean of 3 cars per minute. What is the probability of no cars passing in a minute?
If a random variable X follows a uniform distribution between 0 and 10. what is the probability that X is less than 3?
A die is rolled twice. What is the probability that the sum is 7?
The weight of bags of flour is normally distributed with a mean of 2 kg and a standard deviation of 0.2 kg. What is the probability that a bag weighs between 1.8 kg and 2.2 kg?
For a random variable following a normal distribution. what is the value of the 50th percentile?
The time to complete a task is exponentially distributed with a mean of 20 minutes. What is the probability that it takes more than 30 minutes?
A random variable X has a mean of 5 and a standard deviation of 2. What is P(X>7)?
If a fair coin is flipped 10 times. what is the probability of getting exactly 5 heads?
A continuous random variable X is uniformly distributed between 0 and 1. What is the mean of X?
If X is a normally distributed random variable with mean 0 and standard deviation 1. what is P(X<1)?
The number of calls received by a call center follows a Poisson distribution with a mean of 5 calls per hour. What is the probability of receiving exactly 7 calls in an hour?
